examples: Please extend them the courtesy of your presence.
He was always known for his grace, kindness, and courtesy to people of every rank.

definitions.definition: A polite gesture or remark , especially as opposed to an obligation or standard practice.
examples: I offered them a ride simply as a courtesy .

definitions.definition: Consent or agreement in spite of fact ; indulgence .
examples: They call this pond a lake by courtesy only.

definitions.definition: Willingness or generosity in providing something needed .
examples: They received free advertising through the courtesy of the local newspaper.

definitions.definition: The life interest that the surviving husband has in the real or heritable estate of his wife .

secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A polite gesture or remark , especially as opposed to an obligation or standard practice.
( uncountable ) Consent or agreement in spite of fact ; indulgence .
( uncountable ) Willingness or generosity in providing something needed .
( law ) The life interest that the surviving husband has in the real or heritable estate of his wife .
